TopicTitle: Lost some parts after update to 1.0.5

Articles.Content:
Unmodded installation from Steam. After the update, spacecraft that I was able to launch yesterday contain "locked or experimental parts".

I can see the parts in their normal places in the R&D tree (see screenshot). However, the AE-FF1, one of the nose cones, and one of the solar panels are missing in the toolkit when I go to build or modify a rocket.

This is really disappointing, as it blocks me in my contracts!

I have already verified the integrity of the game cache with Steam, and it shows no problems. "All files verified".

build id = 01024

2015.11.09 at 20:33:38 CET

Branch: master
This is because some of the parts got shifted around the tech tree see http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138802-Kerbal-Space-Program-1-0-5-New-Issues-Repository

This is because some of the parts got shifted around the tech tree see http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138802-Kerbal-Space-Program-1-0-5-New-Issues-Repository

Can you point out where the AE-FF1 is mentioned in the tech tree reshuffling?

Also, please note that in one of the two screenshots, I have highlighted the Aerodynamics component in the tech tree - and there is my AE-FF1. I did read the changelog and don't believe these parts are affected. Or if they are, can you tell me where they are in the new tech tree?

I have to disagree... Please note in the first screenshot I included. I have highlighted the AE-FF1, which is part of the Aerodynamics package. And I do have that in the tech tree. I scoured the R&D section looking for a mention of the AE-FF1 (or the Advanced Nose Cone) and didn't find it.

Alternately, can you point out where in the release notes the fairing is mentioned? I read it carefully before posting here and do not believe any tech tree changes should have changed this.

(Sorry if this is a duplicate response)
Oh, woops. I see it now in Advanced Construction. umm, ok - so the bug is that AE-FF1 appears in both places, because it is indubitably listed as part of Aerodynamics. :/

Pretty sure the duplicate positions is an issue with the moving of the parts and the use of a previous save - Sal highlights a workaround/fix in this list of known issues - http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138802-Kerbal-Space-Program-1-0-5-New-Issues-Repository

give that a shot
